items.title: Thrust library and CUDA API
items.content_text: For long time, I was under the impression that thrust functions can beinvoked only from the main function/Host device. Just got to know that thrust(v1.8+) fucntion can be invocked inside the kernel__global__ void test(float *d_A, int N) {    float sum = thrust::reduce(thrust::seq, d_A, d_A + N);    printf("Device side result = %f\n", sum);}Source: SO link
items.content_html:
For long time, I was under the impression that thrust functions can beinvoked only from the main function/Host device. Just got to know that thrust(v1.8+) fucntion can be invocked inside the kernel

__global__ void test(float *d_A, int N) {    float sum = thrust::reduce(thrust::seq, d_A, d_A + N);    printf("Device side result = %f\n", sum);}

Source: SO link
items.author: Rajesh Pandian M

items.title: CUDA and its questions
items.content_text: There we were some question raised during Rupesh’s GPU class today.  Why is the blockDim.z 64 whereas x and y is 1024  Why is gridDim.y or z is not 2^16 but 2^16-1Sample
items.content_html:
There we were some question raised during Rupesh’s GPU class today.

  • Why is the blockDim.z 64 whereas x and y is 1024
  • Why is gridDim.y or z is not 2^16 but 2^16-1

Sample

items.title: How to use Latex / MathJax in Jekyll
items.content_text: create _include/mathjax.html  add the below code<script type="text/x-mathjax-config">  MathJax.Hub.Config({    extensions: [      "MathMenu.js",      "MathZoom.js",      "AssistiveMML.js",      "a11y/accessibility-menu.js"    ],    jax: ["input/TeX", "output/CommonHTML"],    TeX: {      extensions: [        "AMSmath.js",        "AMSsymbols.js",        "noErrors.js",        "noUndefined.js",      ]    }  });  MathJax.Hub.Register.StartupHook("TeX Jax Ready",function () {    var TEX = MathJax.InputJax.TeX;    var COLS = function (W) {      var WW = [];      for (var i = 0, m = W.length; i < m; i++)        {WW[i] = TEX.Parse.prototype.Em(W[i])}      return WW.join(" ");    };    TEX.Definitions.Add({      environment: {        psmallmatrix: ['Array',null,'(',')','c',COLS([1/3]),".2em",'S',1],      }    });  });</script><script type="text/javascript" async  src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.5/latest.js"></script>  edit _layouts/default.html add a include line before </body>          {\% include mathjax.html \%}              Caution: Remove \ before % (at the beginning and at the end).For some reason jekyll is not allowing me write it              that’s it. Enclose math symbols within $$  e.g Some random     $$A_{m \times n} \cdot B^{n} = C_n $$        some text References  Thanks to Arthur O’Dwyer  Blog  Git code
items.content_html:
• create _include/mathjax.html
  • add the below code
<script type="text/x-mathjax-config">  MathJax.Hub.Config({    extensions: [      "MathMenu.js",      "MathZoom.js",      "AssistiveMML.js",      "a11y/accessibility-menu.js"    ],    jax: ["input/TeX", "output/CommonHTML"],    TeX: {      extensions: [        "AMSmath.js",        "AMSsymbols.js",        "noErrors.js",        "noUndefined.js",      ]    }  });  MathJax.Hub.Register.StartupHook("TeX Jax Ready",function () {    var TEX = MathJax.InputJax.TeX;    var COLS = function (W) {      var WW = [];      for (var i = 0, m = W.length; i < m; i++)        {WW[i] = TEX.Parse.prototype.Em(W[i])}      return WW.join(" ");    };    TEX.Definitions.Add({      environment: {        psmallmatrix: ['Array',null,'(',')','c',COLS([1/3]),".2em",'S',1],      }    });  });</script><script type="text/javascript" async  src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.5/latest.js"></script>
  • edit _layouts/default.html add a include line before </body>

    {\% include mathjax.html \%}

    Caution: Remove \ before % (at the beginning and at the end).For some reason jekyll is not allowing me write it

  • that’s it. Enclose math symbols within $$
  • e.g Some random 
    $$A_{m \times n} \cdot B^{n} = C_n $$
  • some text

References

  • Thanks to Arthur O’Dwyer
  • Blog
  • Git code
items.author: Rajesh Pandian M

items.title: Some new words - inspired by COVID-19
items.content_text: In this novel coronovirus season learnt some new words.  epidemic          a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time.        pandemic          (of a disease) prevalent over a whole country or the world.        Price gouging          Price gouging is a term referring to when a seller increases the prices of goods, to a level much higher than is considered reasonable, and is considered exploitative, potentially to an unethical extent. Usually this event occurs after a demand or supply shock.        Paywall          A paywall is a method of restricting access to content via a purchase or paid subscription      Example sentence.WHO said COVID-19 disease is epidemic and nearly pandemic officially pandemic today. While sellers are price gouging masks/sanitizing items, nature journal removed the paywall for all research involving coronovirus. Sweet!
items.content_html:
In this novel coronovirus season learnt some new words.

  1. epidemic

    a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time.

  2. pandemic

    (of a disease) prevalent over a whole country or the world.

  3. Price gouging

    Price gouging is a term referring to when a seller increases the prices of goods, to a level much higher than is considered reasonable, and is considered exploitative, potentially to an unethical extent. Usually this event occurs after a demand or supply shock.

  4. Paywall

    A paywall is a method of restricting access to content via a purchase or paid subscription

Example sentence.

WHO said COVID-19 disease is epidemic and nearly pandemic officially pandemic today. While sellers are price gouging masks/sanitizing items, nature journal removed the paywall for all research involving coronovirus. Sweet!
items.author: Rajesh Pandian M

items.title: Same spelling but different pronunciation.
items.content_text: So, we know homonyms. Same pronunciation but different spelling/meaning.  e.g. right and writeBut, this word overseas has same spelling but different meaning/pronunciation.  adverb: overseas; /əʊvəˈsiːz/      in or to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.“he spent quite a lot of time working overseas”    adjective: overseas;  /ˈəʊvəsiːz/      from, to, or relating to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.“overseas trips”  Is this also homonyms? Time to see its definition.It seems like. Are there more?
items.content_html:
So, we know homonyms. Same pronunciation but different spelling/meaning.

e.g. right and write

But, this word overseas has same spelling but different meaning/pronunciation.

adverb: overseas; /əʊvəˈsiːz/

in or to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.“he spent quite a lot of time working overseas”

adjective: overseas; /ˈəʊvəsiːz/

from, to, or relating to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.“overseas trips”

Is this also homonyms? Time to see its definition.It seems like. Are there more?
